reviewText: As a true and loyal fan of Roxette's music, after I've been to one of their terrific comeback live shows, I felt I need to dig a little deeper in their musical archive, and to my surprise after logging to their page here on Amazon, I've found out the Swedish duo had a videos collection on DVD, with all their classic known hits since the very beginning in 1986 up to 2001 - and of-course, I had to buy it in other to have a glace at yet another side of Roxette, a decision that prove quite smart of me, since I'm enjoying watching this collection ever since I got it in the mail.The variety of styles in music and directing shows their creativity as long as their longevity, with each video-clip you can sense how much they've progressed musically and artistically, and some of the videos are simply put a thing of art, which reminds me sadly how once there was much more to a video rather than just a promo for a single or for an album... Some ideas here are absolutely inspiring (circa 1993-1995 in particular), joyous or touching, depends on the context of the song. Basically, I call this kind of video collection a music collection with visual bonuses, and when it collects together all the best songs of two as talented people as the two who form Roxette, any music lover simply cannot go wrong with adding it to their DVD collection. A little remark: I didn't find, honestly, no faults with the picture or sound quality, and while some of the late 80's material is a bit campy, still the quality is second to none. To all the Roxette fans out there, get it because it's more than worth checking out, even from the interviews and behind the scenes addition you can learn some interesting facts on the duo. Couldn't recommend it enough, buy it while you still can and... let it roxx you like a baby!
summary: You won't find these kind of videos on MTV no more.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had ordered this through my local music store 10 years ago and wouldn't play on my regular DVD player. I was about to return it, but first I tried it on my DVD burner player and it played, so I decided to keep it. Well, about 2 months ago my DVD burner player just went out one day so I had to get a new one. Unfortunately the new burner wouldn't play this DVD. So I decided to just purchase "Ballad & Pop Hits" since it was made for US players. So now I have both versions. If I had known 10 years ago that "All Videos Ever Made & More" was in PAL format I would have waited for a NTSC version. And wouldn't you know it, 2 years later the NTSC version "Ballad & Pop Hits" was released. But like I said, since it was playing in my burner I had no reason to get the NTSC version 9 years ago. So I guess my burner going out on me a couple months ago gave me a good reason to finally get "Ballad & Pop Hits". So the 4 star is for wrong format, wrong info online, and format not even labeled on DVD case itself. Other than that this DVD would have been a 5 star for great content. This DVD is great cause it has alternate videos and is in chronological order, where "Ballad & Pop Hits" is not in order and no alternate videos."1986: Pearls Of Passion"01. reviewText: All Videos Ever Made and More: Complete CollectionThis has a huge collection of their videos including killer cuts like "She's Got The Look" and "Dressed For Success". Over 90 minutes of material! The latter part of the collection, though, gets more melodic and has less of a 'snap' to it than the earlier stuff. However, I'm told they're still performing in various parts of the world.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Yeah, I must agree with the previous writer / review on Roxette's All Videos ever made & More!  This was one DVD I really wanted to watch.  I was a big Roxette fan, I wanted just to sit down and watch this huge array of their videos.  But I was greatly disappointed when I put the DVD in and it would not read because of the wrong region.  Get your facts right sellers - region free or not!  This is the reason I give a 1 rating.  As a seller, they should know what items sold and right facts.
summary: Roxette - All Videos Ever Made & More!  Is not region free.
